module Koncat.PrettyPrint (
   drawTable
 , drawTable'  
) where

import qualified Data.List as L

-- Take a Multidimensional Array and a delimiter and return prettily lined up text.
-- Check Koncat/Core/Native.hs for a few usecases
drawTable :: [[String]] -> String -> String
drawTable [] _ = []
drawTable i sp = concat $ L.intercalate ['\n':[]] $ L.transpose $ 
             map (\x -> toSpaces sp x) $ putTags i

-- Same, except that the final result isn't concatentated
drawTable' :: [[String]] -> String -> [String]
drawTable' [] _ = []
drawTable' i sp = map concat $ L.transpose $ map (\x -> toSpaces sp x) $ putTags i

-- Tag every Element of the Array with the spaces needed in order
-- to gain an equal length in relation to the longest String in the Array
{-# INLINE putTags #-}
putTags :: [[String]] -> [[(Int, String)]] 
putTags [] = []
putTags i = [numSpaces $ head i] ++ (putTags $ tail i)
  where
    numSpaces :: [String] -> [(Int, String)]   
    numSpaces m = L.zip (map (\x -> (maximum $ map length m) - length x) m) m 

-- Take the Delimiter and the Array created via putTags and reduce it to Rows of
-- equal length
{-# INLINE toSpaces #-}
toSpaces :: String -> [(Int, String)] -> [String]
toSpaces _ []  = []
toSpaces isc i =
    (addSpaces isc $ head i) : (toSpaces isc $ tail i)
  where
    addSpaces :: String -> (Int,String) -> String
    addSpaces isc (n,s) = s ++ L.replicate n ' ' ++ isc
